item.title: Sam add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "When the going gets weird, the weird turn professional." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Sam add a quote by Emil Cioran
item.description: "To accomplish nothing and die of the strain" -- Emil Cioran

item.title: Sam add a quote by Émile Michel Cioran
item.description: "If we could truly see ourselves the way others see us we'd disappear on the spot." -- Émile Michel Cioran

item.title: Sam add a quote by Emil Cioran
item.description: "Shame on the man who goes to his grave escorted by the miserable hopes that have kept him alive." -- Emil Cioran

item.title: Sam add a quote by P. J. O'Rourke
item.description: "Always read stuff that will make you look good if you die in the middle of it." -- P. J. O'Rourke

item.title: Sam add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "All happy families are alike; each unhappy family is unhappy in its own way." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Sam add a quote by George Burns
item.description: "Happiness is having a large, loving, caring, close-knit family in another city." -- George Burns

item.title: Sam add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "He in his madness prays for storms, and dreams that storms will bring him peace" -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Sam add a quote by Salman Rushdie
item.description: "What is freedom of expression? Without the freedom to offend, it ceases to exist." -- Salman Rushdie

item.title: Sam add a quote by Salman Rushdie
item.description: "A poet's work . . . to name the unnamable, to point at frauds, to take sides, start arguments, shape the world and stop it from going to sleep." -- Salman Rushdie

item.title: Sam add a quote by Salman Rushdie
item.description: "To understand just one life you have to swallow the world ... do you wonder, then, that I was a heavy child?" -- Salman Rushdie

item.title: Sam add a quote by Mario Puzo
item.description: "A friend should always underestimate your virtues and an enemy overestimate your faults" -- Mario Puzo

item.title: Sam add a quote by Gustave Flaubert
item.description: "Human speech is like a cracked kettle on which we tap crude rhythms for bears to dance to, while we long to make music that will melt the stars." -- Gustave Flaubert

item.title: Sam add a quote by Jean-Paul Sartre
item.description: "Hell is—other people!" -- Jean-Paul Sartre

item.title: Sam add a quote by Alan Moore
item.description: "My experience of life is that it is not divided up into genres; it’s a horrifying, romantic, tragic, comical, science-fiction cowboy detective novel. You know, with a bit of pornography if you're lucky." -- Alan Moore

item.title: Sam add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "It's easy to fall in love. The hard part is finding someone to catch you." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Sam add a quote by Matt Groening
item.description: "Love is a snowmobile racing across the tundra and then suddenly it flips over, pinning you underneath. At night, the ice weasels come." -- Matt Groening

item.title: Sam add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Those who believe in telekinetics, raise my hand." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Sam add a quote by Louis Mackey
item.description: "Actually, the gap between say Plato or Nietzsche and the average human is greater than the gap between that chimpanzee and the average human." -- Louis Mackey

item.title: Sam add a quote by Bill Maher
item.description:
"There's an old, frequently-used definition of insanity, which is "performing the same action over and over, expecting different results."... Now, I'm no doctor, but I am on TV. And in my professional opinion, George Bush is a paranoid schizophrenic. ...
...Other symptoms of paranoid schizophrenia are: Do you see things that aren't there? Such as a link between 9/11 and Iraq? Do you - do you feel things that you shouldn't be feeling, like a sense of accomplishment? Do you have trouble organizing words into a coherent sentence? Do you hear voices that aren't really there? Like, oh, I don't know, your imaginary friend, Jesus? Telling you to start a war in the Middle East.
Well, guess what? There are a large number of people out there also suffering from the same delusions, because there are Republicans, there are conservatives, and then there are the Bushies. This is the 29 percent of Americans who still think he's doing "a heck of a job, Whitey." And I don't believe that it's coincidence that almost the same number of Americans - 25 percent - told a recent pollster that they believe that this year - this year, 2007 - would bring the Second Coming of Christ!
I have a hunch these are the same people. Because, if you think that you're going to meet Jesus before they cancel "Ugly Betty," then you're used to doing things by faith. And if you have so much blind faith that you think this war is winnable, you're nuts and you shouldn't be allowed near a voting booth." -- Bill Maher

item.title: Sam add a quote by Bill Maher
item.description: "Suicide is man's way of telling God, 'You can't fire me - I quit!" -- Bill Maher

item.title: Sam add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Sam add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "I've had a perfectly wonderful evening, but this wasn't it." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Sam add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "I sent the club a wire stating, PLEASE ACCEPT MY RESIGNATION. I DON'T WANT TO BELONG TO ANY CLUB THAT WILL ACCEPT ME AS A MEMBER." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Sam add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Politics is the art of looking for trouble, finding it everywhere, diagnosing it incorrectly and applying the wrong remedies." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Sam add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "I never forget a face, but in your case I'll be glad to make an exception." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Sam add a quote by Saul Williams
item.description: "I dance for no reason, for reasons you can't dance, Call me an activist of intellectualized circumstance You can't learn my steps until you unlearn your thoughts Spirit, soul, can't be store-bought." -- Saul Williams

item.title: Sam add a quote by Saul Williams
item.description: "the greatest Americans have not been born yet they are waiting patiently for the past to die" -- Saul Williams

item.title: Sam add a quote by Leonard Cohen
item.description: "Poetry is just the evidence of life. If your life is burning well, poetry is just the ash." -- Leonard Cohen

item.title: Sam add a quote by Tom Waits
item.description: "Champagne for my real friends and real pain for my sham friends." -- Tom Waits
